nl.inl.blacklab.index

Class Indexer

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.inl.blacklab.index.Indexer

  • public class Indexer
extends Object
    Tool for indexing. Reports its progress to an IndexListener.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected boolean continueAfterInputError
      Deprecated. 
      (since 1.7) use return value of IndexListener#errorOccurred(String, String, File, File) If an error occurs (e.g. an XML parse error), should we try to continue indexing, or abort?
      protected boolean createAndIndexStartReported
      Have we reported our creation and the start of indexing to the listener yet?
      static Charset DEFAULT_INPUT_ENCODING 
      protected boolean defaultRecurseSubdirs
      Recursively index files inside a directory? (or archive file, if processArchivesAsDirectories == true)
      protected nl.inl.blacklab.index.Indexer.DocIndexerWrapper docIndexerWrapper 
      protected String formatIdentifier
      Format of the documents we're going to be indexing, used to create the correct type of DocIndexer.
      protected Map<String,String> indexerParam
      Parameters we should pass to our DocIndexers upon instantiation.
      protected List<File> linkedFileDirs
      Where to look for files linked from the input files
      protected Function<String,File> linkedFileResolver
      If a file cannot be found in the linkedFileDirs, use this to retrieve it (if present)
      protected IndexListener listener
      Where to report indexing progress.
      protected int maxNumberOfDocsToIndex
      Stop after indexing this number of docs.
      protected org.apache.lucene.document.FieldType metadataFieldTypeTokenized
      How to index metadata fields (tokenized)
      protected org.apache.lucene.document.FieldType metadataFieldTypeUntokenized
      How to index metadata fields (untokenized)
      protected boolean rethrowInputError
      Deprecated. 
      (since 1.7) use IndexListener#errorOccurred(String, String, File, File) If an error occurs (e.g. an XML parse error), and we don't continue indexing, should we re-throw it, or assume the client picked it up in the listener and return normally?
      protected Searcher searcher
      Our index
      protected boolean useThreads
      Index using multiple threads?

                    throws IOException,
                           DocumentFormatException
        Deprecated. 
        Construct Indexer
        Parameters:
        directory - the main BlackLab index directory
        create - if true, creates a new index; otherwise, appends to existing index
        docIndexerClass - how to index the files, or null to autodetect
        Throws:
        IOException
        DocumentFormatException - if no DocIndexer was specified and autodetection failed

               boolean create)
        throws IOException,

        create - if true, creates a new index; otherwise, appends to existing index
        Throws:

      • Indexer

        @Deprecated
public Indexer(File directory,
                           boolean create,
                           Class<? extends DocIndexer> docIndexerClass,
                           File indexTemplateFile)
                    throws DocumentFormatException,
                           IOException
        Deprecated. 
        Construct Indexer
        Parameters:
        directory - the main BlackLab index directory
        create - if true, creates a new index; otherwise, appends to existing index
        docIndexerClass - how to index the files, or null to autodetect
        indexTemplateFile - JSON file to use as template for index structure / metadata (if creating new index)
        Throws:
        DocumentFormatException - if no DocIndexer was specified and autodetection failed
        IOException

      • Indexer

        public Indexer(File directory,
               boolean create,
               String formatIdentifier,
               File indexTemplateFile)
        throws DocumentFormatException,
               IOException
        Construct Indexer
        Parameters:
        directory - the main BlackLab index directory
        create - if true, creates a new index; otherwise, appends to existing index. When creating a new index, a formatIdentifier or an indexTemplateFile containing a valid "documentFormat" value should also be supplied. Otherwise adding new data to the index isn't possible, as we can't construct a DocIndexer to do the actual indexing without a valid formatIdentifier.
        formatIdentifier - (optional) determines how this Indexer will index any new data added to it. If omitted, when opening an existing index, the formatIdentifier in its metadata (as "documentFormat") is used instead. When creating a new index, this format will be stored as the default for that index, unless another default is already set by the indexTemplateFile (as "documentFormat"), it will still be used by this Indexer however.
        indexTemplateFile - JSON file to use as template for index structure / metadata (if creating new index)
        Throws:
        DocumentFormatException - if no formatIdentifier was specified and autodetection failed
        IOException

        public org.apache.lucene.document.FieldType getMetadataFieldType(boolean tokenized)

      • setContinueAfterInputError

        @Deprecated
public void setContinueAfterInputError(boolean b)
        Deprecated. (since 1.7) use return value of IndexListener#errorOccurred(String, String, File, File) If an error occurs (e.g. an XML parse error), should we try to continue indexing, or abort?
        Parameters:
        b - if true, continue; if false, abort

      • setRethrowInputError

        @Deprecated
public void setRethrowInputError(boolean b)
        Deprecated. only functional for index() using reader If an error occurs (e.g. an XML parse error), and we don't continue indexing, should we re-throw it, or assume the client picked it up in the listener and return normally?
        Parameters:
        b - if true, re-throw it; if false, return as normal

      • setProcessArchivesAsDirectories

        public void setProcessArchivesAsDirectories(boolean b)
        When we encounter a zip or tgz file, do we descend into it like it was a directory? Note that for accessing large ZIP files, you need Java 7 which supports the ZIP64 format, otherwise you'll get the "invalid CEN header (bad signature)" error.
        Parameters:
        b - if true, treats zipfiles like a directory and processes all the files inside

      • setRecurseSubdirs

        public void setRecurseSubdirs(boolean recurseSubdirs)
        Should we recursively index files in subdirectories (and archives files, if that setting is on)?
        Parameters:
        recurseSubdirs - true if we should recurse into subdirs

      • getListener

        public IndexListener getListener()
        Get our index listener, or create a console reporting listener if none was set yet. Also reports the creation of the Indexer and start of indexing, if it hadn't been reported already.

        the listener

      • setMaxNumberOfDocsToIndex

        public void setMaxNumberOfDocsToIndex(int n)
        Set number of documents after which we should stop. Useful when testing.
        Parameters:
        n - number of documents after which to stop

      • rollback

        public void rollback()
        Call this to roll back any changes made to the index this session. Calling close() will automatically commit any changes. If you call this method, then call close(), no changes will be committed.

      • close

        public void close()
        Close the index

      • index

        public void index(String documentName,
                  InputStream input)
        Index a document or archive from an InputStream.
        Parameters:
        documentName - name for the InputStream (e.g. name of the file)
        input - the stream

      • index

        public void index(String documentName,
                  Reader reader)
           throws Exception
        Index a document from a Reader. NOTE: it is generally better to supply an (UTF-8) InputStream or byte array directly, as this can in some cases be parsed more efficiently (e.g. using VTD-XML). Catches and reports any errors that occur.
        Parameters:
        documentName - some (preferably unique) name for this document (for example, the file name or path)
        reader - where to index from
        Throws:
        Exception

      • index

        public void index(String fileName,
                  InputStream input,
                  String fileNameGlob)
        Index a document (or archive if enabled by setProcessArchivesAsDirectories(boolean)
        Parameters:
        fileName -
        input -
        fileNameGlob -

      • index

        public void index(File file)
        Index the file or directory specified. Indexes all files in a directory or archive (previously only indexed *.xml; specify a glob if you want this behaviour back, see index(File, String). Recurses into subdirs only if that setting is enabled.
        Parameters:
        file - the input file or directory

      • index

        public void index(File file,
                  String fileNameGlob)
        Index a document, archive (if enabled by setProcessArchivesAsDirectories(boolean), or directory, optionally recursively if set by setRecurseSubdirs(boolean)
        Parameters:
        file -
        fileNameGlob - only files

        glob -
        processArchives -

      • continueIndexing

        public boolean continueIndexing()
        Should we continue indexing or stop? We stop if we've reached the maximum that was set (if any), or if a fatal error has occurred (indicated by terminateIndexing).
        Returns:
        true if we should continue, false if not

      • getSearcher

        public Searcher getSearcher()

      • setLinkedFileDirs

        public void setLinkedFileDirs(List<File> linkedFileDirs)
        Set the directories to search for linked files. DocIndexerXPath allows us to index a second file into the same Lucene document, which is useful for external metadata, etc. This determines how linked files are located.
        Parameters:
        linkedFileDirs - directories to search

      • addLinkedFileDir

        public void addLinkedFileDir(File linkedFileDir)
        Add a directory to search for linked files. DocIndexerXPath allows us to index a second file into the same Lucene document, which is useful for external metadata, etc. This determines how linked files are located.
        Parameters:
        linkedFileDir - directory to search
